title: Petrol Prices Set to Rise Again as Crude Oil Hits $70 Per Barrel
description: Petrol pump prices in Nigeria may rise again as global crude oil prices climb above $70 per barrel. Marketers, experts warn of higher fuel, transport and living costs.

Barely days after petrol pump prices were adjusted upward, Nigerians may be bracing for another increase as crude oil prices continue to rise on the international market.

Nigeria’s Bonny Light crude has climbed to **$70.30 per barrel**, up from **$64 per barrel** last week — a rise of about **10 per cent** and its highest level so far this year. Brent crude, the global benchmark, also rose to **$70.15 per barrel** from **$66**, while Murban crude increased to **$68.01** from **$65.20**.

Earlier this week, petrol stations raised pump prices to an average of **₦850 per litre**, representing a **14.3 per cent** jump from **₦750 per litre**, citing higher crude oil prices as the reason.
